means: [计](=Compact disc read-only memory)（信息容量极大的）光盘只读存储器

sentence.Network_en: You can compress huge amounts of data on to a CD-ROM.
sentence.Network_cn: 可以把大量的数据压缩到一张CD-ROM上。

sentence.Network_en: A single CD-ROM can hold more than 500 megabytes of data.
sentence.Network_cn: 一张只读存储光盘能容纳500兆以上的数据。

sentence.Network_en: A CD-ROM can store more than 250,000 pages of typed text.
sentence.Network_cn: 一张只读光盘能存储25万多页键入的文本。

entry.tran: 只读存储器;只读存储光盘
entry.def: A CD-ROM is a CD on which a very large amount of information can be stored and then read using a computer. CD-ROM is an abbreviation for (缩略=) 'compact disc read-only memory'.

example.ex: A single CD-ROM can hold more than 500 megabytes of data...
example.tran: 一张只读存储光盘能容纳500兆以上的数据。

example.ex: The collected Austen novels on CD-ROM will cost £5.
example.tran: 光盘版的奥斯汀小说集售价为5英镑。

means.word_mean: 1. a compact disk that is used with a computer (rather than with an audio system); a large amount of digital information can be stored and accessed but it cannot be altered by the user
